entry.title: The New CSS Media Query Range Syntax

entry.title: On The Edge Of November (2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)
entry.summary: November is just around the corner, and with it, a new collection of desktop wallpapers to celebrate the beginning of the month. Designed by creatives from all across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar. Let’s make November colorful!

entry.title: How To Create Advanced Animations With CSS
entry.summary: In this article, Yosra Emad explains how to create a rollercoaster path that a ball follows using cubic beziers and CSS transitions. You’ll also learn how the cubic-bezier function in CSS works in detail and how to stack multiple simple animations to create one complex one.

entry.title: Motion Controls In The Browser
entry.summary: If you've ever wanted to build a web app that you can control with hand gestures as if by magic, this article is for you. With a couple of APIs and some JavaScript, you can build apps that behave like sorcery.

entry.title: WordPress Full-Site Editing: A Deep Dive Into The New Feature
entry.summary: In this article, Nick Schäferhoff will take a deep dive into WordPress Full-Site Editing, examine the tools it provides for theme development, and provide a tutorial on how to use it to make changes to your site.

entry.title: Effective Communication For Everyday Meetings
entry.summary: In this article about conducting productive meetings, Andrii Zhdan will give you a step-by-step guide on preparing a solid meeting structure that will let you follow the original plan and reach the meeting goals, and he will also share a few tips based on his design experience.

entry.title: Sustainable Web Development Strategies Within An Organization
entry.summary: Climate change and sustainability are increasing concerns for digital organizations, as well as individuals working in tech. In this article, we’ll explore some of the ways we can raise awareness and effect change within an organization to create a more positive environmental impact.
